recipes.label: Labour as repetitive as the tick of the second hand.
recipes.startdescription: I do no more than clean parts and take orders.

recipes.label: Spend Time on Labour or Research?
recipes.startdescription: I could expend my energies on repairs and sales, or change the sign on the door to closed and devote my time to research.

recipes.label: Labour as repetitive as the tick of the second hand.
recipes.startdescription: Since I was a child I have worked in my father's shop. But I do no more than clean parts and take orders.
recipes.description: No matter how I push myself, my father is never satisfied. But stacking boxes and dealing with customers at least keeps my body occupied, if not my mind.

recipes.label: As repetitive as the tick of the second hand.
recipes.startdescription: I do no more than clean parts and take orders. I do not even have my own key to the shop.
recipes.description: No matter how I push myself, my father is never satisfied.

recipes.label: Full-time Employment
recipes.startdescription: You have impressed your father with your work ethic.
recipes.description: You hold in your hands the keys to the workshop. An iota of trust.

recipes.label: As repetitive as the tick of the second hand.
recipes.startdescription: I take orders, repair broken mechanisms, clean, sell, repeat.
recipes.description: I have done an honest day's work, that at least I can say.

recipes.label: A Workshop in the Back Room
recipes.startdescription: I will close the shop, and set up the workshop to suit my own needs instead of those of my father. [This may take some time.]

recipes.label: Additional Tools & Materials
recipes.startdescription: The workshop does not have everything I need.

recipes.label: An Upgraded Workshop
recipes.startdescription: I will do what I can with what I have...
recipes.description: Everything I need is now in place. There are things that I can now build that I could not before.

recipes.label: An Upgraded Workshop
recipes.startdescription: I will do what I can with what I have...
recipes.description: Some things are hard to build, hard to source. All I can do is brush myself off and try again.

recipes.startdescription: I take orders, repair broken mechanisms, clean, sell, repeat. But the work I do is now for me.
recipes.description: I have done an honest day's work, that at least I can say.

recipes.label: A Workshop in the Back Room
recipes.startdescription: Today I will close the shop, and see what I can make.
recipes.description: I have created something. I am not sure what it does. But perhaps it will be worth some money, to someone.
